channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @joshtpm It’s not espionage if you steal the launch codes for the ratings boost — or your next reality show.
item.source:markdown: @joshtpm It’s not espionage if you steal the launch codes for the ratings boost — or your next reality show.

item.description: @DainyBernstein @MisfitTorah @arosoff Everyone should have Jersey pride!
item.source:markdown: @DainyBernstein @MisfitTorah @arosoff Everyone should have Jersey pride!

item.description: @lurkernonumbers @joshtpm @PatrickRuffini So many of us are not, and we’re all the worse for it.
item.source:markdown: @lurkernonumbers @joshtpm @PatrickRuffini So many of us are not, and we’re all the worse for it.

item.description: @DainyBernstein @MisfitTorah @arosoff Not Oz? Have you no Jersey pride?
item.source:markdown: @DainyBernstein @MisfitTorah @arosoff Not Oz? Have you no Jersey pride?

item.description: @klhoughton Meanwhile, the dioceses are actually talking to parishioners. And some papers are reporting it. https://t.co/zWW8VUFn1C
item.source:markdown: @klhoughton Meanwhile, the dioceses are actually talking to parishioners. And some papers are reporting it. https://t.co/zWW8VUFn1C

item.description:
@DougJBalloon Is this real? Over at the North Jersey Record, @deenayellin recently looked into that question. Except she looked at diocese-sponsored survey of tens of thousands of the rank-and-file.

@DougJBalloon @deenayellin (By real, is this a prediction or a subtweet of a column this morning?)

@DougJBalloon @deenayellin Anyway, here’s the Jersey story. https://t.co/zWW8VUFn1C
@HeerJeet I assume Philip Roth never forgave him.
item.source:markdown: @HeerJeet I assume Philip Roth never forgave him.

item.description:
@Namer98 @JewWhoHasItAll No complaints. But something for corporate party planners to be aware of.

@Namer98 @JewWhoHasItAll Well, occasional complaints, for those occasions where the schach collapsed under several inches of snow.
item.source:markdown:
@Namer98 @JewWhoHasItAll No complaints. But something for corporate party planners to be aware of.
@Namer98 @JewWhoHasItAll Well, occasional complaints, for those occasions where the schach collapsed under several inches of snow.

item.description: @JewWhoHasItAll Though it depends on where. Growing up in Rochester, there was always the risk of snow.
item.source:markdown: @JewWhoHasItAll Though it depends on where. Growing up in Rochester, there was always the risk of snow.

item.description: @AkivaMCohen Thank you from r the opportunity to testify, but I respectfully decline your subpoena out of a sincere desire not to waste your prescious time.
item.source:markdown: @AkivaMCohen Thank you from r the opportunity to testify, but I respectfully decline your subpoena out of a sincere desire not to waste your prescious time.

item.description: @maimonides_nutz Bar Mitzvah was on cassette but junior congregation, a couple years before, we’re on reel-to-reel.
item.source:markdown: @maimonides_nutz Bar Mitzvah was on cassette but junior congregation, a couple years before, we’re on reel-to-reel.

item.description: @DandiaAsad Not going to care what Canadians think about hummus, but: Do you consider it plausible that Dr Oz bought veggies to dip in hummus, then freaked out that that wasn’t “American” enough so stumbled into crudités and tequila salsa?
item.source:markdown: @DandiaAsad Not going to care what Canadians think about hummus, but: Do you consider it plausible that Dr Oz bought veggies to dip in hummus, then freaked out that that wasn’t “American” enough so stumbled into crudités and tequila salsa?

item.description: @ZachWeiner Not a cartoonist, but I may have used it in journalism in the past few months.
item.source:markdown: @ZachWeiner Not a cartoonist, but I may have used it in journalism in the past few months.

item.description: @PFLerner @KeismanPhil The direct approach is problematic at the breakfast table. Best to start with historiographically-themes breakfast cereals.
item.source:markdown: @PFLerner @KeismanPhil The direct approach is problematic at the breakfast table. Best to start with historiographically-themes breakfast cereals.

item.description: @AvBronstein Are you afraid of committing an antisemitism by casting side-eye at a Tikvah Fund culture hero?
item.source:markdown: @AvBronstein Are you afraid of committing an antisemitism by casting side-eye at a Tikvah Fund culture hero?

item.description: @DainyBernstein Say what you want about Italian fascism, but at least it has style.
item.source:markdown: @DainyBernstein Say what you want about Italian fascism, but at least it has style.

item.description: @trekonomics The real question is what system of safeguards and incentives (positive and negative) should there be, and what stops us from reaching that point?
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics The real question is what system of safeguards and incentives (positive and negative) should there be, and what stops us from reaching that point?

item.description: @trekonomics As if you have a better use for atomic bombs. https://t.co/L4uqwiCmZm
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics As if you have a better use for atomic bombs. https://t.co/L4uqwiCmZm

item.description:
@trekonomics Who would have though that if the workers owned the means of production, the agents of the workers would start acting like capitalists?

@trekonomics * thought
item.source:markdown:
@trekonomics Who would have though that if the workers owned the means of production, the agents of the workers would start acting like capitalists?
@trekonomics * thought

item.description:
@trekonomics I mean, existing communism didn’t do much better.

@trekonomics Much of the blame goes to one of the more recent apostate Jews to start a religion, Ayn Rand, who confused “greed is useful” with “greed is good.”
item.source:markdown:
@trekonomics I mean, existing communism didn’t do much better.
@trekonomics Much of the blame goes to one of the more recent apostate Jews to start a religion, Ayn Rand, who confused “greed is useful” with “greed is good.”

item.description: @DainyBernstein Are both titles CIS? Then reuse is very likely.

item.description: @DainyBernstein Either someone made a mistake entering the data or someone improperly reused an ISBN#.

item.description: @DemocraticLuntz Amos was a shepherd, if I recall correctly. Jeremiah was a priest. Malachi was a fictitious literary creation. Did any of the others have day jobs?
item.source:markdown: @DemocraticLuntz Amos was a shepherd, if I recall correctly. Jeremiah was a priest. Malachi was a fictitious literary creation. Did any of the others have day jobs?
